Name: Somaseshu Gutala
Title: A very beajutifuul temple with landscaped garden and sculptures nearer to the city
Review: On my Visit to Ratnalayam (Shamirpet, Hyderabad)For city people, ‚ÄúRatnalayam temple‚Äù is a nearby sacred place of Lord Venkateshwara where one can see a model temple construction with beautiful surroundings, serene atmosphere, clean ambiance and modern facilities. This temple was constructed by T.R.Venkatesh just for family worship, but gradually expanded into a big temple. This temple was inaugurated by Swami Jayendra Saraswati on 19th February, 2003 with blessings of Chinna Jeeyar Swamiji Just like Birla temple, this temple is a tourist attraction. Here many T.V. serials are shot showing the landscape and shady trees dotted with beautiful fountains and statues. This temple is located at Aliapur Cross Roads near Aliabad bus stop. From the temple arch, it is only 200 meters distant.  It is nearly 30 kms from Hyderabad. The famous Saraswati temple at Wargal is just 25 kms away from this place. So, one can plan to visit both places.People of all ages including kids find this place quite interesting and delightful. The architecture of this temple and landscaped gardens is quite attractive and impressive. There is wide parking space with a beautiful garden at the entrance with water fountain structures in the form of Lord‚Äôs sacred Namam flanked by Shanku and Chakram. At another place one can see a fountain with figures of Lord Vishnu reclining on Adisesha with Lakshmi near His feet. The statue of Krishna dancing on the hoods of Kaliya amidst waters is another eye-catching spectacle. As one ascends the steps towards the main temple one can see the shrine of Lord Ganesha near the entrance. The statue in the main temple resembles the idol of Lord Venkateshwara in Tirupati. Lotus carvings in attractive colors are seen on the ceiling of the central hall. Poojas are done here as per Pancharatra Agama of Vaishanavite tradition. On either side of the main sanctum there are sub-shrines for Goddess Padmavati and Goda Devi. The idols are made of black granite and look very beautiful decked with jewelry and floral decorations. These idols were sculptured by the famous sculptor Sri Ganapathy Sthapathy and were brought from Kanchipuram. Near the main hall or mukha mandapam, there is a counter for selling tickets for various poojas and for selling prasadam packets. While going down the stairs on the way, there is a shrine of Goddess Kanyaka Parameshwari. There is also another shrine for Lord Hanuman.  In this temple there is a hall for doing tonsuring (Kalyana katta), a lecure-hall, a hall for performing homams, a goshala(cattle-shed). Along with temple rituals one can also perform ceremonies like Aksharabhyasam, Anna Prashan, Namakaranam, Sayanarayana Vratam, Gopuja and Vahana Pooja. Special poojas and rituals are done on festive days like Vaikunta Ekadashi, Janmashtami, Dussehra, Diwali and Sankranti. There is a separate area with swings and slides for kids to play. There is a small canteen beside the garden.  It is really a visual treat for city people to spend their time along with their kids in this temple located in serene and scenic surroundings. The temple timings are from 6.00 a.m. to 12.00 noon and from 4.00 p.m. to 8.00 p.m.

Name: Raj
Title: My experience
Review: Nice temple   super place  great  location one of the Very special  temple in Hyderabad very spacious....

Name: The Food Wanderer
Title: A Marvel
Review: The architecture in the temple was amazing. The main temple was sorrounded by a lush green gardens and fountains and there was ample parking space. Food is also provided during weddings.

Name: Capture photovideo Krishna
Title: Peaceful ...
Review: My first visit there make me discovered the peace and pure atmosphere of the environment and truly a destressful place to be ... a visit is a must....

Name: idea614354
Title: Neat and clean
Review: Temple premises maintenense is very good, greenary very nice. good atmosphere also. very huge space availbale for kids play and others.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Decent place for family weekend visit
Review: Nice and neatly maintained place. Could visit during weekend with family and friends. Evenings are better option as there are some special puja's are performed.

Name: GS R
Title: Very Green and peaceful temple
Review: This temple premises is located outside the city skirmishes of Hyderabad. It's a well maintained temple with abundance of green cover. It hosts Lord Ganesha temple, Lord Shri Venkateswara Swamy temple and Lord Hanuman temple. Its a very photogenic place with fresh air and people can generally spend here 1 to 2 hours.

Name: lalnat
Title: Amazing temple
Review: Replicates Tirupati . Lots of space. Well maintained . Also has a small park for kids . Neat and clean .

Name: Binoda C
Title: Wow it is amazing !!!!
Review: Please visit it when you at Hyderabad .. it is called Tirupati of Hyderabad. Nice place having with garden facility.Never you feel the boar after visit.

Name: eMokshaa
Title: Calm and Quiet Temple
Review: A simple well maintained calm and quiet temple away from cacophony of a large city. One may visit any day of the week though it is little crowded on weekends. Pious place to visit with family.

Name: Usha65
Title: One of the good temples in suburbs
Review: A very good temple and the main deity here is Lord Venkateswara. There also Lord Hanuman and Lord Ganesha temples inside. The are around the temple serve as a good picnic area.

Name: Srinivas A
Title: Neat and clean Worship place with Childrens play park
Review: A must visit Lord Balaji temple at Ratnalayam . The place is clean and neat with all facilities and ampule car parking and good play out area for small children. About the temple - its surrounded just on the Karimnagar Highway and 35KM from Secunderabad well connected with Buses . On visiting the temple  you feel more spiritual  and one can imagine Lord Balaji Idol of Tirupati much similar . You have various pooja offering's to do according to your convenience.

Name: Aruna G
Title: Rathnalayam
Review: Excellent place to visit with all the family members irrespective of age.. For kids we have playing resources, water fountain, peaceful temple interior.. Everyone will like the place..

Name: Amogh Natu
Title: Very beautiful and peaceful place to visit with family including children
Review: A very well maintained and planned temple. I visited the temple in the evening time. There was no rush at all and the temple premises are very very clean. Another point I noticed is that the temple premises are very well planned. There is also a childrens' play area which is great for little kids and also for youngsters. Overall, this is a very good place to spend quality time with family, even with kids. One more point I just have to make is that the laddus and wada are just too delicious!!  Make sure you try them! üòä

Name: lakjoth
Title: Wonderful place
Review: This is  quite far from the city central.  Very  beautiful temple with statue of   Lord Vishnu as Shesha shayee. The temple has got all the facilities for the  people  like drinking water good parking area

Name: lakjoth
Title: Great place of  devotion to God
Review: This is a  vey nice temple in Shamipet area. The  temple is not within city limits, but  good transport facility is available. The temple has got  all the  basic facilites for the  devotees

Name: rajuashetty
Title: Powerfull Lord Venkateshwara Swamy Temple
Review: Superb temple, with lots of Greenary around very near to Hyderabad area, and good to go with family and kids..
